Thanks for your update. Since the RODCPurgeAccount operation did not resolve the issue, there are a few additional steps that may help:

Check if the account is still in use – If the account is still being referenced, it may prevent removal.


	Use repadmin to manually clear cached credentials:


repadmin /prp remove <RODC_Name> <Account_Name>


	Use Clear-ADAccountPasswordCache to remove stored credentials:


Clear-ADAccountPasswordCache -Identity <RODC_Name>

Rebuilding the RODC – If the above steps do not work, Microsoft's official recommendation remains to rebuild the RODC to ensure proper removal.

Check if the account is still in use – If the account is still being referenced, it may prevent removal.


	Use repadmin to manually clear cached credentials:


repadmin /prp remove <RODC_Name> <Account_Name>


	Use Clear-ADAccountPasswordCache to remove stored credentials:


Clear-ADAccountPasswordCache -Identity <RODC_Name>
